lineage_mutations(pango_lin, mutation, freq)¶

outbreak_data.lineage_mutations(pango_lin, mutations=None, freq=0.8, server='api.outbreak.info', auth=None)¶

Retrieves data from all mutations in a specified lineage above a frequency threshold. - Mutiple queries for lineages and mutations can be separated by “,” - Use ‘OR’ in a string to return overlapping mutations in multiple lineages: ‘BA.2 OR BA.1’ - param mutation is only useful for one lineage + mutation1 + mutation2 …. combinations

Arguments:
param pango_lin

A string or list; loads data for all mutations in a specified PANGO lineage

param mutation

A string or list; loads data of mutations for sequences classified as a specified PANGO lineage with mutation

param freq

A number between 0 and 1 specifying the frequency threshold above which to return mutations (default = 0.8)

return

A pandas dataframe

Example usage:¶
     foo = lineage_mutations('b.1.1.7')
Mutiple queries for lineages and mutations can be separated by “,”¶
     Ex:  foo = lineage_mutations('b.1.1.7, b.2, ay.2')
Use ‘OR’ in a string to return overlapping mutations in multiple lineages.¶
     Ex:  foo = lineage_mutations('ba.2 OR b.1.1.7')
